[if cgi junksubmit] [or cgi cancelsubmit] Hit action for no-content [tag op=header]Status: 204 No content[/tag] [goto] [/if] [set page_title]Menu Loader[/set] [tmpn dhtml_required]1[/tmpn] [set ui_class]Design[/set] [set page_perm]layout=e[/set] [set help_name]menu.edit[/set] [set icon_name]icon_pages.gif[/set] [tmp meta_header] [include include/table_populator] [/tmp] @_UI_STD_HEAD_@
[loop list="tree __MV_TREE_TABLE__"] [flag type=write table="[loop-code]"] [/loop] [if !cgi qmenu_products] [cgi name=qmenu_products set=__ProductFiles_0__ hide=1] [cgi name=qmenu_comb_field set=comb_category hide=1] [cgi name=qmenu_toplevel_field set=prod_group hide=1] [cgi name=qmenu_sublevel_field set=category hide=1] [/if] [tabbed-display ui_style=1 js-prefix=mvtb_ panel-height="500px" panel_style=" font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 10px; border: 2px; border-color:#999999; border-style:outset; " panel-shade=f panel_id=mvspan2 tab_style=" font-size:10px; text-align:center; font-family: sans-serif; line-height:150%; border:2px; border-color:#999999; border-style:outset; border-bottom-style:none;"] [tabbed-panel Group and Category Fields]
This function loads a tree menu based on the contents of two category fields, producing a two-level tree with individual products/items as a leaf on the third level. The menu may be added to after that.
Table Default: products
Top level field Default: prod_group
Sub level field Default: category
Sort string Determines extra information in search link. Default: tf=prod_group,category
Options Override, build even if large   Use to allow building even if the table is defined as LARGE
 
Do menu build
[/tabbed-panel] [tabbed-panel Combined category field]
This function loads a tree menu based on the contents of a combined category field. Example:
First level:Second Level A
First level:Second Level B
First level:Second Level B: Third level A
First level:Second Level B: Third level B
Table Default: products
Field to use Default: comb_category
Sort field (Default: comb_category)
Sort string Determines extra information in search link. Default: tf=comb_category,description
Options Override, build even if large   Use to allow building even if the table is defined as LARGE
 
Do menu build
[/tabbed-panel] [tabbed-panel Top and Sub Level Tables]

This function loads a tree menu based on the contents of two tables. (Typically these are the Interchange 4 area and cat tables. It produces a two-level tree based on the relationship of the second level (cat) table sel field containing the code of the top level (area) table.

The menu may be added to after that.

Top Level table Default: area
Sub Level table Default: cat
Selector (if any) [display type=select name=qmenu_sel_value lookup_query="select distinct sel from area" options="=none" cgi=1] Default: none
Options Override, build even if large   Use to allow building even if the table is defined as LARGE
 
Do menu build
[/tabbed-panel] [/tabbed-display]
@_UI_STD_FOOTER_@
